metadata.title: Trend Mentions by Topic
metadata.about: This dataset is an anonymized derivative of the original data about trends for collections development identified during interviews and working group sessions. Dataset contains a list of all trends and their associated description and number of mentions.

Access to information and technology res.name: Access to information and technology resources, changing patron expectations for
Access to information and technology res.description: Patrons now expect to have remote, unlimited, and constantly available access to information and technology resources, such as software and articles online

Article-level access, increased demand f.name: Article-level access, increased demand for
Article-level access, increased demand f.description: Patrons and collections development professionals are increasingly demanding access to individual articles, rather than simply entire databases of articles

Asymmetric impact of digital revolution.name: Asymmetric impact of digital revolution on academic disciplines
Asymmetric impact of digital revolution.description: Despite the increased number of electronic resources, scholarly resources in some academic disciplines are still only available in print and will continue to be for the foreseeable future

Big data.name: Big data
Big data.description: Refers to a collection of datasets so large and complex that it is challenging to manage it using traditional database or information management tools (Source: Wikipedia)

Born-digital content, proliferation of.name: Born-digital content, proliferation of
Born-digital content, proliferation of.description: Content that is born-digital is becoming increasingly common

Born-digital materials, impact on resear.name: Born-digital materials, impact on research and learning
Born-digital materials, impact on resear.description: The impact of born-digital materials on the research and learning process

Born-digital content, challenges of coll.name: Born-digital content, challenges of collecting
Born-digital content, challenges of coll.description: Born-digital materials poses special challenges to collecting, especially in relation to preservation, that print materials do not pose.

Challenges inherent in building hybrid a.name: Challenges inherent in building hybrid archives, increased awareness of
Challenges inherent in building hybrid a.description: Institutions, libraries, and collections development professionals have become increasingly aware of the challenges of building and maintaining collections that include print, digital, and special collections materials

Content control, changes in models of.name: Content control, changes in models of
Content control, changes in models of.description: With the rise of e-resources, there have been changes in models of content control, in particular pertaining to owning vs. leasing of content.

Collaboration between researchers, incre.name: Collaboration between researchers, increased frequency of
Collaboration between researchers, incre.description: More researchers are collaborating with one another, facilitated by technologies such as social networking

Collaborative collections and collection.name: Collaborative collections and collections development
Collaborative collections and collection.description: As funding pressure has increased, collections development professionals have increasingly turned to collaborations to increase the scope of materials for their patrons and reduce direct costs

Collaborative collections development, d.name: Collaborative collections development, difficulty of maintaining
Collaborative collections development, d.description: Although collaborative collecting agreements can be attractive, they can also be very difficult to maintain.

Collecting practices, changes in.name: Collecting practices, changes in
Collecting practices, changes in.description: Increasingly, libraries can no longer 'collect for the ages', and instead must focus on meeting immediate patron needs  or collecting distinctive materials

Collecting practices, impact of modes of.name: Collecting practices, impact of modes of discovery upon
Collecting practices, impact of modes of.description: The relationship between modes of discovery and collecting practices

Collections in the Cloud, increased inte.name: Collections in the Cloud, increased interest in
Collections in the Cloud, increased inte.description: Describes the services involved in providing access to data stored remotely via a network (Source: Wikipedia); assumption is that some digital collections will be hosted in this manner

Cooperative digital preservation infrast.name: Cooperative digital preservation infrastructure, creation of
Cooperative digital preservation infrast.description: Infrastructure that is developed in partnership with other organizations for the purposes of long term digital preservation

Computational scholarship, rise of.name: Computational scholarship, rise of
Computational scholarship, rise of.description: The rise of more disciplines using computational strategies to analyze datasets or create scholarship (e.g. computational journalism, the digital humanities)

Content aggregators, proliferation of.name: Content aggregators, proliferation of
Content aggregators, proliferation of.description: Given the increased number of digital resources being created and that are now publicly available, there has been a proliferation of agents engaged in repackaging and aggregating these sources into consolidated data streams

Content remixing, practice of.name: Content remixing, practice of
Content remixing, practice of.description: Given the increase availability of freely available digital resources, more individuals are remixing content they find online for use in other applications such as course work, new modes of communication, and new digital works

Continued relevance of print in certain.name: Continued relevance of print in certain subject areas
Continued relevance of print in certain.description: Despite the increased number of electronic resources, scholarly resources in some academic disciplines are still only available in print and will continue to be for the foreseeable future

Cross- and inter-disciplinary scholarshi.name: Cross- and inter-disciplinary scholarship and research activities, increased frequency of
Cross- and inter-disciplinary scholarshi.description: An increasing number of researchers and faculty are engaging in research and collaborations that span disciplines giving rise to more cross- (and inter-) disciplinary research activities

Cross-repository information, increased.name: Cross-repository information, increased production of
Cross-repository information, increased.description: Collections that span multiple repositories (e.g. digital collections) are becoming more common

Crowd-sourced curation, rise of.name: Crowd-sourced curation, rise of
Crowd-sourced curation, rise of.description: Increasingly, the curation of digital content (e.g. images) is being crowd-sourced

Data provenance, increased importance of.name: Data provenance, increased importance of
Data provenance, increased importance of.description: As more scholars make use of datasets, it has become increasingly important to them that the provenance of the data be explicated and well-understood

Data-driven collecting decisions, increa.name: Data-driven collecting decisions, increased practice of (e.g. bibliometrics)
Data-driven collecting decisions, increa.description: Increasingly, libraries are requiring that collections (and other budget items) justify their purchasing decisions using quantitative means

Datamining, increased practice of.name: Datamining, increased practice of
Datamining, increased practice of.description: As big datasets have become more available, researchers and commercial organizations have begun to mine these datasets for interesting relationships and insights

Datasets, increased need to collect and.name: Datasets, increased need to collect and curate
Datasets, increased need to collect and.description: As more scholars become involved in research that draws upon data (e.g. computational scholarship), it has become more pressing that libraries create ways to manage the datasets that researchers generate as a side effect of their scholarship as well as the primary data that they need to perform their research

Digital collections, increased importanc.name: Digital collections, increased importance of
Digital collections, increased importanc.description: Patron access expectations, as well as a desire to make 'hidden' collections more accessible to others, and an increase in funding for digitization projects is driving the increased importance of library digital collections

Digital content and digital formats, pro.name: Digital content and digital formats, proliferation and wide availability of
Digital content and digital formats, pro.description: Digital content (free and that which is behind pay walls) is now widely available. Content aggregators have helped to fuel this availability

Digital content and networks, increased.name: Digital content and networks, increased use of to perform research activities
Digital content and networks, increased.description: Increasingly, digital content and networks are being employed to perform research activities such as gathering and analyzing data and sharing results

Digital curation and management, increas.name: Digital curation and management, increased interest in and need for
Digital curation and management, increas.description: As a result of increase demand that libraries collect digital materials, libraries have begun to investigate how to manage the maintenance and preservation aspects of the information lifecycle

Digital formats, increased awareness of.name: Digital formats, increased awareness of complexity of for storage and preservation
Digital formats, increased awareness of.description: Digital formats require special treatment for preservation that is different from treatments required by print materials. Increasingly, institutions are becoming aware of and attempting to systematically address this complexity.

Digital humanities, rise of.name: Digital humanities, rise of
Digital humanities, rise of.description: Digital humanities is an area of research, teaching, and creation concerned with the intersection of computing and the disciplines of the humanities. It is linked to Computational scholarship

Digital learning objects, increase in nu.name: Digital learning objects, increase in number of
Digital learning objects, increase in nu.description: With the rise of online courses, there has been an increase in the number of digital learning objects available

Digital objects that are entangled with.name: Digital objects that are entangled with hardware, proliferation of
Digital objects that are entangled with.description: Increasingly, digital objects are entangled with hardware platforms. E-books are an example of this, where some formats (e.g. EPUB) only work on certain e-readers

Digital objects that are entangled with.name: Digital objects that are entangled with services, proliferation of
Digital objects that are entangled with.description: Increasingly, digital objects are entangled with services and/or software (e.g. GIS datasets and architectural data). For instance, some data formats can only be used with certain software that must be licensed

Digital projects, increased number of no.name: Digital projects, increased number of non-profit
Digital projects, increased number of no.description: There are an increasing number of digital projects that are funded by non-profit organizations

Digital storage and long-term preservati.name: Digital storage and long-term preservation, increased importance of
Digital storage and long-term preservati.description: The tail end of the information lifecycle has become increasingly important, especially in light of the transience of some digital material (e.g. websites)

Digital student portfolios, proliferatio.name: Digital student portfolios, proliferation of
Digital student portfolios, proliferatio.description: Changes in teaching and learning have also altered student output. Many courses now require students to create electronic portfolios of work. Researchers also may have digital work portfolios including images, video, and electronic documents.

Digitization of rare or 'hidden' materia.name: Digitization of rare or 'hidden' materials, increased frequency of
Digitization of rare or 'hidden' materia.description: Increasingly, institutions are focusing their efforts on making special collections or hidden materials in their collections more accessible by digitizing them

E-resources, changing models of ownershi.name: E-resources, changing models of ownership
E-resources, changing models of ownershi.description: There is a shift from ownership of content to purchasing access to content

E-resources, cost of.name: E-resources, cost of
E-resources, cost of.description: The price of licensing e-resources is rising

E-resources, proliferation of.name: E-resources, proliferation of
E-resources, proliferation of.description: The publishing industry has responded to the demand for e-resources by making more of them more widely available (for a fee). The digital revolution has also made it easier to self-publish digital resources

Evidence-based decision making.name: Evidence-based decision making
Evidence-based decision making.description: Increasingly, libraries are requiring that collections (and other budget items) justify their purchasing decisions using metric-based means

Embedded digital objects.name: Embedded digital objects
Embedded digital objects.description: Given the proliferation of digital content, users are now embedding these digital objects into other objects to create new works. See content remixing and the Open Education Movement as an example.

Faculty use of new technologies for rese.name: Faculty use of new technologies for research, increase of
Faculty use of new technologies for rese.description: Increasingly, faculty are making use of new technologies to conduct their research and to use as primary research materials

Floundering of national partnerships.name: Floundering of national partnerships
Floundering of national partnerships.description: Various national collecting partnerships, which are difficult to maintain, are having difficulty staying cohesive and effective

Faculty-driven collecting, resurgence of.name: Faculty-driven collecting, resurgence of
Faculty-driven collecting, resurgence of.description: Collections development that is guided by immediate faculty needs has become more common once again

Full text access, increased desire for a.name: Full text access, increased desire for and availability of
Full text access, increased desire for a.description: Database vendors are making full text access to articles more common

Funding constraints and competition.name: Funding constraints and competition
Funding constraints and competition.description: There is funding competition within libraries, institutions, and other organizations

Gaps in born-digital collecting, increas.name: Gaps in born-digital collecting, increased awareness of
Gaps in born-digital collecting, increas.description: There has been increased awareness that there has been an asymmetric impact of the digital revolution on different academic disciplines

Gaps in interdisciplinary collecting, in.name: Gaps in interdisciplinary collecting, increase awareness of
Gaps in interdisciplinary collecting, in.description: As interdisciplinary research has increased, there is likewise an increasing awareness that there are gaps in collecting practices for interdisciplinary subject areas

Global political unrest, affect upon col.name: Global political unrest, affect upon collecting practices
Global political unrest, affect upon col.description: Collecting practices may be affected by political or social unrest. This is important now that scholarship has become more global and it has become more important to collect global materials

Grant-funded projects to address shared.name: Grant-funded projects to address shared collections, increased use of
Grant-funded projects to address shared.description: More libraries will collaborate and use grant funds to build shared collections

Growth of co-authorship across instituti.name: Growth of co-authorship across institutions and schools
Growth of co-authorship across instituti.description: Increasingly, scholars are partnering across schools and institutions to create scholarship together, some of which may be interdisciplinary in nature

Growth of knowledge, increased pace of.name: Growth of knowledge, increased pace of
Growth of knowledge, increased pace of.description: Knowledge of all sorts has been growing at an increased rate

Homogenization of library collections.name: Homogenization of library collections
Homogenization of library collections.description: Due to certain types of collecting practices, library collections are at risk of becoming homogenized

Impact of discovery on choice of databas.name: Impact of discovery on choice of database purchases
Impact of discovery on choice of databas.description: Mechanisms for discovery may have significant impact upon which databases a library chooses to purchase

Item-level finding aids, availability of.name: Item-level finding aids, availability of
Item-level finding aids, availability of.description: There will be an increase in the availability of item-level finding aids.

Justification of information resource pu.name: Justification of information resource purchases, increased pressure for
Justification of information resource pu.description: There is increased pressure upon libraries to justify their collections decisions

Knowledge, increased proliferation and w.name: Knowledge, increased proliferation and wide availability of
Knowledge, increased proliferation and w.description: Information of all types, print and digital, is available in massive quantities and increasing amounts

Knowledge embedded in networks and relat.name: Knowledge embedded in networks and relationships, increase in amount of
Knowledge embedded in networks and relat.description: Increase in the amount of knowledge embedded in networks

Loss of private and institutional archiv.name: Loss of private and institutional archival material
Loss of private and institutional archiv.description: Loss of private and institution archival materials

Merging of archival, museum, library rol.name: Merging of archival, museum, library roles in collections development
Merging of archival, museum, library rol.description: As collections become more heterogeneous, various curatorial roles appear to be merging

Metadata, lack of subject cataloging for.name: Metadata, lack of subject cataloging for
Metadata, lack of subject cataloging for.description: The movement towards minimal subject cataloging may have a negative impact on having rich metadata for search and discovery

Metadata support for open standards.name: Metadata support for open standards
Metadata support for open standards.description: Increase in the amount of open metadata standards

Mis-match between areas of Harvard's res.name: Mis-match between areas of Harvard's research growth and collections growth
Mis-match between areas of Harvard's res.description: The areas in which Harvard has experienced growth in its research and scholarship output and those in which it has experienced collections growth are not congruent

Move from institution-centered collectio.name: Move from institution-centered collections to user-centered collections
Move from institution-centered collectio.description: Move from institution-centered collections to user-centered collections

National mandates for open access, rise.name: National mandates for open access, rise of
National mandates for open access, rise.description: Rise of national mandates for Open access scholarship and publishing

On-demand/just-in-time acquisitions, ris.name: On-demand/just-in-time acquisitions, rise of and balance between
On-demand/just-in-time acquisitions, ris.description: Rise of on-demand and just-in-time acquisitions practices

Open access journals (and resources), pr.name: Open access journals (and resources), proliferation of or interest in
Open access journals (and resources), pr.description: With the increasing costs and restrictions placed upon research journals, more researchers (and research funding agencies, like the NIH) are expressing interest in Open access publications

Open access journals, lack of faculty in.name: Open access journals, lack of faculty incentive to publish in
Open access journals, lack of faculty in.description: Due to the fact that tenure decisions are often tied to publication in certain prestigious journals, there can be a lack of incentive for new/up-and-coming faculty to publish in Open access journals

Open Education Movement.name: Open Education Movement
Open Education Movement.description: A collective term that refers to educational organizations that seek to eliminate barriers to entry. Such institutions, for example, would not have academic admission requirements. Such universities include Open University in Britain and Athabasca University in Canada. Such programs are commonly distance learning programs like e-learning, MOOCs and open courseware, but not necessarily (Source: Wikipedia)

Patron-driven acquisition, increased pra.name: Patron-driven acquisition, increased practice of
Patron-driven acquisition, increased pra.description: Describes the practice of acquiring resources based upon patron-demand, as opposed to acquiring resources chosen by selectors

Physical space, implications for short-.name: Physical space, implications for short- and long-term storage of print
Physical space, implications for short-.description: The decreasing availability of physical space needed to store print materials is playing a role in the movement to collect more digital materials

Primary research materials, increased co.name: Primary research materials, increased collecting of by libraries
Primary research materials, increased co.description: Increasingly, researchers and faculty are requesting that libraries collect, curate, and preserve primary research materials that are digital or of unusual formats (e.g. ephemera)

Public services, increased importance of.name: Public services, increased importance of
Public services, increased importance of.description: Services to patron are becoming increasingly important as collections, especially digital collections, require more reference or specialty services to provide maximum benefit to patrons

Push-back against vendor pricing for res.name: Push-back against vendor pricing for resources, increased incidence of
Push-back against vendor pricing for res.description: Increasingly, libraries are pushing back against vendors regarding pricing, packaging, and terms of use for resources, including electronic resources

Relationships with vendors having non-ac.name: Relationships with vendors having non-academic subscription models, increased number of
Relationships with vendors having non-ac.description: Increasingly, content that scholars want access to are not available from traditional publishers. This requires that libraries enter relationships with vendors that do not have traditional academic subscription models

Remote access to collections, patron des.name: Remote access to collections, patron desire for
Remote access to collections, patron des.description: Patrons want access to library collections from remote locations (online)

Scholarly communication, new forms of.name: Scholarly communication, new forms of
Scholarly communication, new forms of.description: There are now few forms of communication between scholars and the scholarly community

Scholarship and/or research, new forms o.name: Scholarship and/or research, new forms of
Scholarship and/or research, new forms o.description: Scholarship is taking new forms beyond traditional peer-reviewed articles published in journals

Self-published content, increased rate o.name: Self-published content, increased rate of creation and promotion
Self-published content, increased rate o.description: Individuals and scholars are increasingly publishing their own content on the Web

Shadow libraries, rise of.name: Shadow libraries, rise of
Shadow libraries, rise of.description: Shadow libraries are libraries whose contents are provided to users for free. May be related to MOOCs.

Shared catalogs, increased prevalence of.name: Shared catalogs, increased prevalence of
Shared catalogs, increased prevalence of.description: Increasingly, institutions are sharing their catalogues (e.g. OPACs) with one-another and with patrons. This is connected to new collaborations between institutions.

Shared print collections, increased prac.name: Shared print collections, increased practice of
Shared print collections, increased prac.description: With the  increasing cost of print resources as well as physical storage space, many institutions and schools are sharing their print collections

Shift from comprehensive collecting to n.name: Shift from comprehensive collecting to narrowly-focused collecting
Shift from comprehensive collecting to n.description: Libraries have begun shifting from collecting as broadly as possible to collecting based upon a tight interpretation of their mission. This has implications for preserving the breadth of scholarship across multiple institutions

Shrinking number of research libraries.name: Shrinking number of research libraries
Shrinking number of research libraries.description: Due to larger economic forces and funding constraints, the overall number of research libraries in the United States is shrinking*

Social networking and social media, incr.name: Social networking and social media, increased scholarly use of
Social networking and social media, incr.description: Scholars are increasingly using social networking to collaborate and share results and using the knowledge/relationships within these networks as sources of primary research materials

Special and distinctive collections, inc.name: Special and distinctive collections, increased importance of
Special and distinctive collections, inc.description: Libraries' special and distinctive collections have become increasingly important as libraries (and institutions) strive to emphasis the unique materials, including digital objects and print ephemera, in their collections rather than their more homogeneous contents

Strategic collecting between universitie.name: Strategic collecting between universities, rise of
Strategic collecting between universitie.description: Due to funding constraints and escalating costs of materials, universities have begun to cooperate in the collecting of materials

Use statistics, increased importance of.name: Use statistics, increased importance of
Use statistics, increased importance of.description: Measuring the frequency with which resources has become increasingly important as collections development professionals are called upon to justify their collecting decisions

Vendors offering enhanced services, incr.name: Vendors offering enhanced services, increased number of
Vendors offering enhanced services, incr.description: In order to find new markets for their products and to justify price increases, vendors have begun to offer enhanced services to their customers
